title: Add uploaded photos to public assets and update homepage to load them

requirements.text: Add the two newly uploaded image files `IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg` and `image-1.jpg` to the frontend static assets directory at `frontend/public/assets/generated/` with the exact same filenames (including case and punctuation) so they are included in production builds.

quotes: Yes add both these image to the assets folder and update the homepage to load the images

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg` exists in the repo and is served by the app in production.
`frontend/public/assets/generated/image-1.jpg` exists in the repo and is served by the app in production.
No backend image serving is introduced; both images are referenced as public static assets.

requirements.text: Update the homepage (`frontend/src/App.tsx`) to load and display the newly added images using the existing deployment-safe `getAssetUrl(...)` helper (Vite `BASE_URL` compatible), without using absolute root paths. Use `IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg` as the homepage couple-photo default/fallback image shown before any user selects a different file, and also render `image-1.jpg` visibly on the homepage as an additional photo element that does not interfere with the Yes/No button interaction or the Yes-button growth behavior.

quotes: update the homepage to load the images

acceptanceCriteria: Before any user file selection, the main homepage couple photo renders from `getAssetUrl('assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg')` and does not trigger the inline default-image load error.
`image-1.jpg` is also displayed on the homepage (e.g., as a secondary smaller image or inset) and is loaded via `getAssetUrl('assets/generated/image-1.jpg')`.
The secondary image placement does not overlap or block the Yes/No buttons at any stage, including after multiple No clicks when the Yes button scales up.
All homepage references to these default assets use `getAssetUrl(...)` (no `src="/assets/..."` absolute-root paths).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and anything under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Do not serve images from the backend; images must live under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and be referenced from the UI.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are needed for this request.
nonGoals: Changing the Valentine modal default image or its asset path (unless required to keep the build passing).
Adding any backend storage/upload functionality for images.
Changing the existing Yes/No interaction logic beyond what is necessary to avoid layout interference from the additional homepage image.
